alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 7:52PM MDT until May 17 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Near Chamita affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Chama Above Abiquiu affecting Rio Arriba County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is a combination of upstream dam releases and snowmelt. * WHERE...Rio Chama near Chamita. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 6.7 feet Friday morning. - Action stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
